tSTPK6o1orJpmdMaKnQZMg.text: Best Pad See Ew in Charlotte (I ordered with Shrimp spice level 3). Can't wait to go back and try the other dishes and sushi. Very friendly and attentive staff.

dmnU9p_v6uox2bSu9UegHA.text: I've only been here once since I live over an hour away, but the experience was fantastic! The service is very cordial and great at letting you take your time. In addition to the comfortable atmosphere, the restaurant is very clean. Plus, the food is superb. As a person with Celiac's Disease, I surprisingly had a lot of appetizing options here. Their lunch deals are fairly cheap, and I love the complimentary small salad and sweet tea. I ordered the pad thai with seafood--which was $4 extra, but completely worth it. Sometimes restaurants cook the dish blandly, but Deejai made it savory with plenty of garnishes. Overall, the food is simultaneously delicious and affordable!

Y9p8l1evM2CPOmjFLHuZYw.text: This was by far the best Thai food I have had in the Carolinas. Really nice addition to Noda where more vegan options are needed.

1iPDVit3oqPJEvz2gtgZHQ.text: Drunken noodles are killer. They are level three hot, not good enough. I get them level four and they bring some heat. They are very tasty and they can accommodate me and make them vegan. The tofu is awesome in the bowl. I just had a Girl Scout cookie beer last night and it was great. Should have got it for dessert but I downed it well before my noodles came out. Parking is tight so be aware.

J3civ404ACpAu3eMgXIc3g.text: Ordered the Nam Prik Chicken and got shrimp instead. After a long wait for the unresponsive staff to get my order right the food was terrible.

2PGp4M91Z0VcRklYp-VZ3Q.text: I loveeeeee this place. I had the salmon curry it was delicious. The atmosphere is nice and although it's at the end of NoDa it's still walkable for the Community. It is right by my office and I plan to frequent often.

hL-ObDmbLA3NJfazblHnnA.text: , B bService excellent.  Food (Pad Tai) excellent.  Great outdoor patio.  My wife loved her pork dish.  Well worth the drive for us coming from Ballantyne.  May take the trolley on next visit.

ZodhSJZBiXAuKVWEYtEO6A.text: Excellent food!!we always love to visit this place for office lunch as a group. Have ordered fried rice with tofu and it exceeded my expectations. My colleagues also ordered variety of dishes and all enjoyed a lot.

m92c5IsFzSwYdWGRyteIbw.text: Been here twice. I forget what I ordered the first time, but it was good enough to make me want to return. The second time I got the papaya salad, which is listed as an appetizer but is easily enough for a meal. It may be the best version of this dish I've had. It included two kinds of sausage and tiny crab legs with edible shells. The menu includes some other Lao and Northern Thai dishes I'd like to try. I wouldn't order sushi at a Thai restaurant, though.

_pw-oeCx9PadR3IOMLJGtw.text: This place was a lunch find on the run through Noda, Charlotte . Great menu and the taste was excellent.  The atmosphere is good although quiet at lunch time.  Once the light rail gets here that maybe a different story.  I had the boat noodles and really enjoyed them. Great place and will get better.

7QhAnfaUnmBTzu4-s7Iwnw.text: Service was very attentive. Great to have a tasty Thai restaurant on this side of town.

9m7ltoJ8wte81eVixHpW7g.text: Went here for the first time with my dad who was visiting, and we had the most amazing time! The service was impeccable and the food was absolutely amazing! We didn't have a single complaint. Everyone working was so attentive and nice, and the atmosphere was really great too. Will definitely be back and will definitely recommend to all my friends!

odRsz87hJoezcLvpF7wEIQ.text: So excited to have this spot in NoDa now!  From the pineapple martinis to the kimchi poke bowl it was awesome.  Not to mention our server was great!  We will be back soon!

yV99UdunDD5b0ZtN4hJFrg.text: Not someplace I would visit again.  Service was awful. We were seated immediately.  Only 2 sets of utensils were left on the table. We had to ask for straws. There were four of us, 2 dinners arrived, it took 20 minutes for the second 2 dinners. We had to ask for additional utensils.  The Aztec and Kimchi bowls were good, the Pad Thai arrived piping hot.  With the Ba Mi Pad Hang, the duck was delicious, tasty and tender. The noodles were bland and marginally warm.  Had I not waited 20 minutes longer than 2 of my table mates, I would have sent it back to heat the noodles. After a wait of 15 minutes, the server came by and said the 2 hot dishes  would be out soon. After another 5 minutes we asked the manager to check on our food.  He got results and our food came.

CH-NhV8tilbqSsGo13rLrA.text: Love the atmosphere they created and it's very hip vibe for Asian food. The decor, location and food is on point! I would say dine in is always better than carry out.

bO5rzcop2S_Sg38WFPAq8A.text: I like their out door patio. They have really good fried spring rolls. The sushi is ok. You can really get a good bang for your buck if you buy their Groupon deal.

nv-KNpU7NO2FCAMvs75Udw.text: Ahhh! Love the pad Thai, wings and dumplings! I tried their sampler platter during Divine Barrel brewery's opening and they gave me so much food on one plate. I will definitely be going back soon!

They said they called back to let us know, but we never got a call. Been pretty satisfied with the food - we did order out from here twice in one week- but don't think we're going back after tonight

Y_sZkCdSB8nlHUJ7csV97A.text: Superb food. Tried five things from their menu, and each one excellent. When they say "spicy" they don't mean wimpy American spicy, so be warned. And, they deliver next door to Divine Barrel Brewing (sweet)! Highly recommend for delicious Thai influenced street food.

mQicIQgvDH6wL-0JA-rGfg.text: Went to Deejai last night for a sushi snack.   We ordered the Sushi special for the night, the NoDa Roll & the Honey Honey roll. They were both awesome. I have to say the sushi is probably the best I have had in Charlotte, fresh and full of flavor. They told me that there is sushi on lunch special M-F....now, if I can only find more time for my lunch hour.

zZqsfQs0ttPvGu_fqh554Q.text: Service was excellent.  I go for lunch between work and every time I go I feel welcomed.   The food is another amazing thing. There are so many great dishes to choose from. I always have something new to try. You don't question the authenticity of the cultural dishes because of how great they are and how honest the people seem to be.   It is located next to crown station which is another great spot to drink some delicious cocktails.  A two for one deal!  Will definitely go again.

lY29LCVxFFzj1V1UbClD0w.text: The atmosphere walking in was amazing, great setting, especially being in the NODA area, I went in for a late lunch and was attended to immediately. I ordered the pad Thai, with the highest spice level and it was satisfying but being Thai myself it left more to be desired, overall the food and the atmosphere was excellent. Would recommend to friends and family.

2VyVhDhC9Jh67TMudKNELw.text: Wings are AMAZING so much flavor there are 100 . Ordered drunken noodles with chicken and it was fantastic . The fried rice in one of the best I've ever tried and pairing the meal with a Thai tea makes this place a go to spot . Highly recommended

55MTK7Jvtfy9cQV49bHl9g.text: So my experience was mediocre to say the least. The server I had and the greeter I had were not welcoming in the least. My server passed me by at least 5 times and I believe I waited 8-10 minutes before I could have my order taken. This is all while every other table including ones that came after me were receiving service. I'm very patient but I do peep things. The only reason my review has three stars is because the food was so good. I would recommend getting your food to go or another server. I can't tell you who I had because she didn't even tell me her name now that I think of it. But the more mature Asian waitress with the bob hair cut was very nice and got me my check and to go box promptly. Probably will try other places before going back here.

photos.caption: Photo of Deejai  Noodle Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States

lr5b69EUEkmm6hE53n1QkQ.text: Our order was placed pretty quickly when we arrived but our meal took 45 minutes to arrive to the table and was incorrect, but we were too hungry to send it back. During our 45 minute wait, our beverages, even though they were just water, were never refilled.  We saw another couple arrive, order, and pay their check through the duration of our wait. Also, when I approached our waitress about this, she said that everyone's wait was long and that our food would be out soon, no apology. The check was incorrect and we were charged for extra crab when my boyfriends dish contained no crab at all.   On top of that, the food was just ok, approaching subpar.  Save your time and money, just go to Thai Taste.

TV-geTsqViMig0mH1MhdFQ.text: Deejai Noda was a pleasant find for us! Right when we approached the door, the staff greeted us with a friendly smile. Although it was a Friday night we were immediately seated. We Were given prompt attention. The young lady (I think her name is Lotty) was very nice and friendly and quite on top of things. We had our drinks promptly. On this particular night they had Tequila Sunrises on sale. It literally was the best Tequila Sunrise that I had ever drank! For the meal I had the Seafood Poke. This was soooo good. Fresh ingredients were certainly used. You could just taste the freshness with each bite. It had eel skin, shrimp, small softshell crab, tuna, salmon. It was sooo good. We also got the Honey Roll. Some of the best sushi ever! This place is great. I will be back to try other options. Good drink, Good food, and Great service...Why not!

photos.caption: Photo of Deejai  Noodle Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Seafood Poke&#39;....hit all the taste buds just right! Very refreshing!
Photo of Deejai  Noodle Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Best sunrise in Charlotte!

rUVeUJUqgYGcgof8Pztu0g.text: Pretty excellent overall. Service is helpful and pleasant. Food is really tasty, and can be made to personal preference. Our fave is the Hawaiian poke bowl--but watch out, it packs a punch heat-wise. Good selection of sake. Definitely one of our to-go haunts. Keep in mind each location caters to a slightly different crowd. The location in Noda is a good selection of sushi and other Asian-fusion faves.

PLFArLwjmnzfhw03337VbQ.text: The noodle menu is amazing and delish! My favorite is the curry noodles (khao soy). The pork belly tacos with the homemade cilantro sauce are great apps to get your tastebuds wanting more. When I keep returning more than once to a place, it only means they have created a dish so good that can't be found anywhere else. I also enjoy the nice cozy space they have and the service is always good.

H1awSu86tnp4pQDmLmFgzw.text: Overall, Deejai Noodle Bar in NoDa is putting out some interesting dishes in a cool space, but nothing about it knocked my socks off.  Pros: Interesting noodle dishes. I had the salmon curry. Tasty but I wouldn't get it again. The salmon was cooked perfectly but the thin rice noodles and thick curry sauce didn't work for me. The kimchi poke bowl was tasty. I'd get that again.   Cons: The parking lot is weird to get in and out of. Save yourself the headache and park around the building. Service was fine but nothing to write home about.   Glad to see the ethnic cuisine scene in Charlotte expanding. I'll definitely give them another shot.

Really nice atmosphere and the sushi we ordered was really really good. I normally don't eat sushi that's raw but the honey honey roll was just so damn delicious. a5hlmJWF9c5yI6ymxYlGbg.text: Hands down the best Thai food in Charlotte! We honeymooned in Thailand is this is the closest we have found to being back!  The service was great, and the restaurant had a cool vibe!

7Z1QXOcKhWYifNURxUiKQg.text: We've had 2 great experiences at Deejai NoDa!  The first time we visited was an impromptu date night and the second time was dinner with some friends.  The staff is incredible- very friendly and always willing to offer up some recommendations.   A few stand out dishes:  Thai spicy sausage- appetizer Kau Gai- noodle stir fry (we got ours with chicken and shrimp... life changing!) Lemongrass pork- vermicelli noodle dish Green curry- served with rice Nam Prik- noodle soup with a rich coconut broth   Don't forget to check in on yelp! Your first check in gets you an edamame app. They also have some incredible sauces like a spicy cilantro fish sauce and spicy chili garlic that you have to ask for. Particularly yummy on the Kau Gai!  Can't wait to return to explore the menu more :)

Ec2PhfCCxmNYZLjj8iD_pA.text: This is a great new Thai spot that will soon be right off of the light rail. The food was quite good and there was a huge menu with a lot of variety on it. There were noodle dishes, poke bowls, Curry, and more. I got one of the noodle dishes and it was great. The papaya salad was also very good. My husband loved his poke bowl. My favorite thing was the mango rice pudding that I got for dessert. We went for an early dinner on a weeknight and it was empty  I would definitely come back again!

KZLDGrNhpQsl-09ba0HM3A.text: Noodle bar... Sounds too good to be True however its real. Basically an all in one Asian super store. Interesting variety of different noodle and Asian dishes. Boat noodles was a pleasant pho version. However if your out looking for pho, I'd look at a different joint. However, with that being said the menu is stunning with a bold variety. You want find shrimp sauce here however you will find this delicious cilantro lime hot sauce that seems vinegar based and is off the chain. Like put it in my baby bottle divine. Good stuff. I would say nothing on the menu would disappoint. Sushi, curry, pad Thai, drunken noodles, pork belly tacos... This place will literally blow your millennial head off and it will land on the hipsters plate next to you. Enjoy.

ykLOxhOgCq4gabmUB55uMQ.text: The best Thai food I've had in Charlotte! I highly recommend the Pad Thai or Drunken Noodles. They have a great selection of local craft beer and wine too! It always runs a little spicier than other Thai places, I recommend ordering a level below what you normally would!

dQeF7GcdqPdkCKk3ODjnaA.text: I think this might be my first five star review. Currently eating my leftover Drunken Noodles-Chicken (plenty of chicken btw) from last night, thinking of my next visit. Mmmm...the wings were a great starter, perfect crisp! They do not skimp on the spice and I am NOT mad at them. My partner had the salmon curry, man WHAT?! Amazing. Beautiful dishes, the aroma, flavor was not lacking. Look, just go! Service A-1!!!

XPeCHMrN3GdlPsQei6Lrvw.text: I have been here multiple times.  Each time I've visited the wait staff was responsive and polite.  The food is always excellent and the prices are not outrageous. I like to order a different item each time I visit.  Once I ordered something that was a bit too spicy for my delicate digestive system and it was replaced.  I appreciated that type of customer service (which seems to be lost in most establishments nowadays).  This place is on my regular rotation now for take-out and casual dining!

bO_RP5_KI8jQg5qFfKt6Ig.text: I came here on a Sunday night with a few friends. We were excited to try this new Thai place. The interior is cool and has a trendy vibe, and there is a bar as well as a sushi bar area as well.   I had the drunken noodles, which is my usual order if they don't have pad see ew. Although the flavors were there and they didn't shy away from spice which is something I appreciate, there were just too few noodles in my dish. I found myself hunting and digging within my vegetables to find the noodles to eat. I think they could have lessened the amount of bell peppers and broccoli a significant amount to find a better balance. I'd have to come here again to see if this was a fluke or if they consistently don't add enough noodles. This is why I'm giving it 4 stars, because if it is a fluke and they usually give more, it would be an excellent dish.   My friend had one of their curries which she did enjoy, although it wasn't the best she's ever had. She also ordered an avocado bubble tea and while it was good, it was definitely coconut flavored instead of the avocado she ordered. They also put whipped cream on top which was not completely necessary, but some might like it.

photos.caption: Photo of Deejai  Noodle Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Drunken noodles.

5oUgfi-NveTBVVj3rQdJNg.text: Excellent Thai place located next to Crown Station in Noda. I'm a big fan of Thai food, and for those of you who are not, you are most certainly missing out. Like many Thai places, this one has a scale ranging from 1-5 in which you can select your level of spice you want on your food. I decided on a 3 which proved to be a bit too mild for me, but i tend to really like spicy food.   I chose the Chicken Pad Thai, (a classic American choice I know), but I wanted to play it safe with a new restaurant choice. I cannot comment much on the inside of the restaurant other than it was well lit and appeared to have modern seating. There was also outdoor seating available.   I was hanging out at Crown Station next door and the hostess said she would be more than happy to bring my food over. It was a healthy portion and not lacking in flavor by any means. If you like Thai, or if you're looking to broaden your taste buds check out Deejai!

eTHWLhuHzwdFt2YccP2klQ.text: Love this place. Very friendly, attentive, clean & the food is delicious! The drunken noodles are so good! My husband loves the wings.

3_MxlK03KlptIbnaMEXrzQ.text: So I decided to take my family out to eat and decide on  one of our favoites. Entering into the location, it is always peaceful and welcoming.  We really enjoy that as a family. Sitting near the front, the light gave us the perfect ambiance for our food and so I can look into my baeh, baeh eyes.  She really enjoys this place. Appetizer included mussels and chicken wings.  The mussels comes in this curry cream sauce that never makes it to the dishwasher.  I got the Tsunami roll, delicious and we shared the dry duck bowl. I am not the wordsmith with it comes to food,  it I really enjoy my family and when they are happy, I am happy.

Photo of Deejai  Noodle Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Mussels, delicious.  I will eat this every time we visit thus place.

n8HUEICESaPWRMiD66tzjQ.text: Just another joint I can say I've tried.   My food was just okay.   I think it's a bit odd (is it just me) that hard boiled eggs are in the Ramen. The short rib joint was just okay. The flavor was a bit one dimensional. I think I'll stick to Futo for the Ramen.   The honey honey sushi was regular to me. Like something I've had at other places. I think I'll stick to Fujo for my Godzilla roll. That's my barometer for sushi.   So this is where things got a bit muddled....  My homie gets the lemongrass chicken dish and he wasn't feeling it because he said the ground up chicken tasted like it was chicken sausage, and the flavor was okay. So he ordered the pork chop with some rice and he ate a piece off the end. When he cut into it it was pink. He asked me if it was undercooked and I was like yea, it's too pink. So he sends that back. You don't want to play with undercooked Pork. The manager or owner maybe came through apologizing profusely and mentioned this is the second time this has happened. Uh oh!   They comped his meal and asked if he wanted anything else. He got the chicken wings. He said they were good. I saw a lady by us tearing her wings up! Like no meat left.  So because everyone was so caught up in how they messed up on my homies food, no one asked me how my food was.... if I needed anything... if I cared for any dessert.   I'm only speaking on my experience (clearly) and they did great with rectifying the situation with my homie, but that left me out of the picture. I wasn't looking for some free food or a constant stream of check ins. Maybe just "how was your food ma'am?"  I don't think i would have cared about that if my food was great, but because it was aight, my experience isn't soured, it's just eh.

Photo of Deejai  Noodle Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Honey Honey Roll

GVEDiHrbQjg8OvHATz9Z7Q.text: Deejaj Noda goes hard in the thai food game. From service to food you guys are excellent. Came here in a group of about 11. We were seated quickly and the wait staff was on it from the get go. They were more than friendly. Attentive as could be and lightening fast. I ordered the drunken noodles with chicken (level 3 spicy) food came out in an extremely timely manner. Everyone was satisfied with what they ordered. If I am ever in need of a thai food fix I'll be back.

t4Z3iUnCVIazOyT8fybjOA.text: I ate there for the first time last week.  It was lunch and i got a noodle bowl and split a sushi roll. The food was extremely fresh and tasty. The best sushi I have had in Charlotte. The parking lot is small but there is parking across the street and it is a warehouse district so go park on the street  Exceptional food and service

c8sV3q64LyUMFc99j_glEg.text: Let me start by saying I found this place after seeing the Groupon deal. After reading some of the reviews I had some concerns about service but thankfully there were no issues. We were greeted as soon as we entered and seated promptly. The server explained the drink specials for the day as well as answered any menu questions.  The not-so-good news: they were out of spring rolls! Needless to say I was disappointed as they are a staple to just about every Asian restaurant. But understanding that things happen, decided to go with the pork belly tacos and Thai chicken wings as appetizers. The tacos were the stand out of the two. The pork belly was just crispy enough like I prefer. The wings were good but average.  On to the sushi course. We ordered both the panther and honey honey roll. It was very fresh and tasty. I would have to say that I preferred the panther roll even though I'm not usually a hug fan of soft shell crab but the flavors were delicious! The honey honey roll was good too but more suited to someone looking for a more basic roll.  By the time the entrees came out we were stuffed and boxed them up to go. I was even more pleased when I went to dig into my box later that night. The spicy basil chicken and the drunken noodles with shrimp were as spicy as requested and flavorful. They work on the standard 5-star spicy rating system. We requested a 4 on both dishes and they delivered. The drunken noodles had ample shrimp and the noodles were cooked perfectly. The spicy basil was bursting with flavor while the jasmine rice complemented it well. Groupon may have lured me in but the food and service is what will bring me back!  Note: Parking is super tight so just be prepared.

photos.caption: Photo of Deejai  Noodle Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Spicy basil chicken (top) and shrimp drunken noodles. Both with 4-star spicy level.
Photo of Deejai  Noodle Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Thai chicken wings
Photo of Deejai  Noodle Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Pork belly tacos, panther roll (left), and honey honey roll (right)

5Xsg4gGQUY5U19Y_4oKGCg.text: Deejai NoDa has become our go-to spot for thai deliciousness.  Prior to Deejai NoDa, we would venture to various locations across the city for tasty thai - I don't think it's particularly hard to find in Charlotte.  But, what I love about Deejai NoDa is the addition of poke bowls and great service.  You can also order online and have it delivered next door to Crown Station or Divine Barrell - win/win!

uh_hOmXcONPp1JT_9jy7og.text: Really delicious food! We all loved our meals. Went based off yelp reviews and ordered the salmon curry, spicy basil chicken, drunken noodles, and honey honey roll. Really fresh ingredients and delicious flavors. Such a cute place and great service. Thai iced tea was also delicious. We will definitely be returning soon!

LBe_B2Fz6jA34bQOCJ4IvA.text: I love this place! Love the atmosphere! Love the food! The only thing I can complain about is the parking. It sucks! Parking on the other side of the street and crossing the street is not safe for no one. Service is AMAZING! Food is AWESOME! Love. Love. Love their pork skins!!!!

B9OkDZgXgsye_-B4uQdTNw.text: Amazing as per usual. Chicken pad thai was delicious and they give you so much of it you can really feed three people. So good!

OjKRiue5uLJ51swFyYvRQg.text: Beyond disappointed at my dinner experience last night at DeeJai in Noda. 2 friends and I went in for dinner last night, ordered apps, 3 entrees and a 24oz bottle of sake. They were out of the big bottles so they brought us 2 small bottles instead. We decided to just go with one small bottle and not the 2. We ate, drank, and dinner was great as usual...   When we got the check, we saw that we were charged the price for the big bottle, which was $35.00 when it should have been $14 for the small bottle. We brought this to the attention of our server, she quickly went back to change the check for us. This is when everything literally went to hell. The "manager" comes up to us trying to explain (VERY RUDELY) that we didn't get the 10 oz bottle of sake for $14 but we got half of a 24oz bottle for $35, so the check should be $17.50. We were confused because they don't serve 12oz bottles of sake JUST 10oz and 24oz. After trying to figure this whole situation out, going back and forth with this manager, I asked her to please ring in the correct bottle and then we will pay the check (at this time we were still being charged for half the bottle of $17.50). She refuses, and says she cannot delete things on her POS system.... ANYONE who has EVER worked in service industry knows that is a bold face lie... The manager on duty REFUSED to fix our check. Not only did she refuse to fix our check, she was the rudest, most unprofessional "manager" I have ever encountered. Our poor server was appalled throughout this entire situation. I wouldn't be surprised if she quit after seeing her "manager" act in such a manner.  After being a loyal DeeJai customer since opening, my party and I will not be returning here. The way that the LADY MANAGER WITH THE SHORT HAIR (I never got her name) handled everything, and the way that she spoke to us was beyond inappropriate and just down right rude. Worst customer service I have EVER experienced...

ZBiXvjPhdi1kk4RXaGsR1A.text: My favorite spot to go, the drinks are to die for. The food is always on point and is on the healthier side.

F1f-w6W2B9tfOG91ZJg36Q.text: This place is tucked away beside Crown Station and it was a great find!  We had the Thai Sausage and Spring Rolls for appetizers.  Both were really good.  The Thai sausage was a little bit charred which was just the way we like it.  Spring rolls came out nice and hot.  My main dish was the Ramen Slow-Cooked Short Ribs and it was perfect for a cold night!  The broth was a little thicker than the usual broth which I really liked, and the noodles themselves were great!  The ribs were nice and tender and pretty lean too.  My boyfriend had the Pad See Ew which didn't disappoint and is always a classic favorite.  And last but not least, the crepe dessert was delicious!  They ran out of bananas and used mangos instead and I'm so glad they did!  The crepe itself was crispy and flaky, the perfect texture and flavor.  We'll definitely be back again!

3UX78vOBzNq66nJyzgtQUA.text: I moved to Charlotte from LA and let me tell you, LA has the most AMAZING Thai food in the US. But this place right here is SO GOOD!!! I very much recommend it!! If you like curry, get their Green Curry. Their other dishes are great too and their portions are HUGE so you'll definitely have leftovers. Even a fat guy like me couldn't finish it all haha!

Yh6C38J65JphMFaZYgUNZg.text: The way you treat your customers is everything. Just moved to the neighborhood and was extremely excited to try this place. I am obsessed with noodles/sushi/Thai so I was very much looking forward to making this my go-to spot. I ordered online, got a confirmation on the screen, an email that my account was created, and a charge on my credit card. When I got to the restaurant, they couldn't find an order from me. I wasn't the only one. I waited over 30 mins to speak to the manager because the hostess (who was very sweet) wasn't sure what to do.  I continuously clicked the link to take me to my account to show my orders but it only brought me to the menu.   The manager came - she was extremely rude and belittling, that despite all of my evidence there was no way it was an error on their end or in their system and there was nothing she could (or would) do.   I am not confrontational, one to argue, or be rude. I am patient and am always understanding because things happen. But instead I left empty handed and in tears because of how this manager treated me.

otE3qXsOCerhIoFAb3YjGg.text: First time at the restaurant and definitely will be back! Ordered the honey honey roll, pad Thai with chicken, and the crunch shrimp roll. Honey honey was amazing! Pad Thai was beautifully presented. The interior was very modern. Great date night!

TgmMQgJV2pXZ4CWFJ9AnoQ.text: terrible service. was waiting at the door for about 10 minutes to get seated. they showed priority to the take outs and it's too tight spaced. a girl in front of us that had a take out placed an order online and they claimed they never got the order, mind you she paid online as well and had the confirmation receipt. ridiculous that she left without her food. when we got sat we waited another 10 minutes for our server to come and he/she never did so my husband and i left. i hate writing bad reviews just because i work at a restaurant as well and have been in the restaurant industry for 4 years so i am very understanding of most situations, but this was nothing but disorganized. the only good thing i can say about this place, was the ambiance. i was really looking forward to this place since i was recommended here, but unfortunately we will not be coming back

p-x14bbIiwTeIcIwS4EhcA.text: Best Pad Se Eww I've had in CLT, hands down. Chill place and good service. Will be back to try other dishes. Check it out!

hZHag0DoGWsPPMzUJBzLZQ.text: The food is pretty good but the service was incredibly slow. We made a reservation for two for 5:30 on Sunday and was asked if we had a Groupon, which we did. When we arrived at 5:15pm, there was hardly anyone there so we were seated immediately. We ordered the papaya noodle salad appetizer from one waitress and then our entrees from another. The appetizer arrived in about 10 minutes after we ordered. As we were eating, we discovered that there was a piece of hair on the bottom of an egg. Then, we waited for an hour for the entrees to be served. I asked the second waitress if it usually takes this long for the food to be cooked. She told me that unfortunately, it does because they go in the order our tickets are placed in the line. This didn't make sense to us because we had previously come to the restaurant two weeks ago on a very busy Friday night. Our food was served in half the time. I am very torn to come back or not because of the second experience.

So57RFrrmGNZqYcadJL3_w.text: Excellent little Thai place in Noda. Very sleek and new inside, although it gets tight when busy with the narrow floor plan. The food is excellent. Great sushi, really yummy noodle dishes - my favorite is the Pad See Ew (which isn't listed on the menu online but I always get in the restaurant), and incredible Thai wings!

vyz5dgJaugL6YSqN1ZJwLQ.text: Great new NoDa addition. Clean and modern environment. Sake and Asian beer selection is good. Food is fantastic! Knowledgeable Sushi Chef on site. The Ahi Poke bowl was excellent!

5oP5m06DknO3UqYV_Xs5zQ.text: This place just popped up off of Craighead Dr., and I had to check it out. Came here for a birthday lunch and wow... I started by sitting outside, but the sun kept pounding us so we came inside. Such nice decor.  I ordered a Strawberry Blossom drink. To be honest, I forgot what was in it, but obvioiusly strawberry juice, and some kind of sake. Oh!! There was rum in there. AH-MAZING. For my food, I ordered the Ba Mi Ped w/ Broth. They have a version of this that is dry, but I couldn't imagine the dish dry. The broth set it over the top. I'll definitely order again.  If there is one con.. I would say it's the service. Waitress was very attentive but it took a while to try to track someone down for me to get to-go containers and some other things. That is not going to stop me from going again because the food was fantastic. Forget that I even mentioned that con.  Just bring yourself here with a nice group of friends. The ambiance is fabulous, the drinks were fabulous, the food was fabulous, and you will be too once you leave. Two thumbs up.

p6oVuGv9qSNsh8TNyHWiVg.text: Update: came back the following weekend and with my sister we tried new dishes and were not disappointed! The kao piek sen is just like my moms, absolutely comforting. The Salmon curry noodles were delicious in a generous portion! And the boat noodles had such a great beefy flavor to them! We also tried the dynamite roll which my husband loved and the spicy tuna poke bowl which was amazing. I'm excited to try more menu items and we can't wait to tell all of our friends about this awesome new spot!

xNP7f9GJnzDkBwVdYtEl5g.text: We had a Groupon for this restaurant that was about to expire so we decided to go on the earlier side to avoid crowds. At first it was hard to find a restaurant since it's in such an industrial part of no die and parking in the front of the restaurant is definitely tight. Easier parking is found in the lot behind the restaurant. There are some tables for outdoor seating, but we decided to sit inside because it was quite warm. The restaurants interior has an easy urban elegance to it and we were seated at a table along the wall. Although the restaurant wasn't very busy on a Saturday at 4:30, I did have to signal the waitress a couple times and we needed something. Everyone that works there seemed very nice.  We started out with some Edamame which was free since I posted a check in for the restaurant. Then we had some fried wonton dumpling Which were hot and delicious, served with a sweet and spicy chili oil sauce. For entrees I had the roast duck with noodles and I had it with broth which was delicious. My vegetarian daughter had the pad Thai with tofu and said it was great. My youngest daughter had the Short rib Ramen and my husband had the lemongrass pork which both were yummy as well! We took leftovers with us but had to have dessert of course. We shared the sweet rice pudding with mango and the moji green tea ice cream which capped off a delightful dinner! We will definitely be back for another memorable meal in the near future

QXifpY0yBkx5YwyB6W5NRA.text: Amazing food!!! The flavors are amazing and the plates are delicious. We came here for date night and were looking forward to good food! We were not disappointed. I ordered the salmon curry and it was phenomenal. The only issue that we came across was that it took the a VERY long time to get our food out. Even just the edamame. Just for the appetizer alone it took around 20-25 min. It was a long time after that when we received our entrees.  So if you are in a rush definitely don't go. Other than that the atmosphere is welcoming and the food is absolutely delicious.

VVSKGislQ83dB55fV1S8dA.text: Was craving Thai food so I decided to order takeout from Deejai Noda. This was my first time getting food from here and I'm sad I haven't heard about this place sooner! I ordered the vegetable lover rice bowl and was amazed but how much flavor was packed into this dish! The entree included broccoli, green beans, cabbage, mushroom, carrots and fried tofu. The portion was a pretty good size but next time I'll be asking for lite tofu, I prefer a lot of vegetables! I ordered a 3 on the spicy level and I thought it was the perfect level. I'm the type of person who enjoys really spicy food and I personally thought the 3 was a good level. If you don't like spicy food then I recommend getting a 1 or 2.

iK-jddJy0uusA8M9_ySYzw.text: First impressions are everything to me when walking into an establishment and when I first walked in, I wasn't greeted or given a menu or anything. I waited a few minutes and still nothing.  I came back a couple of hours later, calling my order in ahead using their online menu and picked up the food, it was ready right then. I had the Pad See You Tofu and my love had the Ramen Short Ribs. My selection was pretty good but apparently the ramen short ribs needed seasoning and were average tasting. Their spring rolls are delicious! I may return and try other options and wish that I was able to be wow'ed my first time eating here because having a Thai spot iso close to where I live  is awesome in theory, better luck next time.

XfDQss74l8rx1itbIpmLuA.text: Sushi. Game. Strong. Could not pick a favorite, so I recommend getting a few rolls & splitting for the table. (Left- right: panther, honey honey, shrimp crunch, tsunami)   Tsunami is fried but not overwhelmingly so; fear not, fellow health nuts

nHNaVEG4-JRE8lWNo7kvRw.text: Played hookie today from work with the boo and looking for something close to home in NODA and once again Yelp to the rescue.   What a freaking gem for a noodle fanatic like me and so close to home. This is definitely my new favorite spot. Our waitress was very personable, friendly, attentive and actually seemed to love what she does. The initial walk-in I started to question the level of service bc the guy who I later found out was the bar back took us to the table without saying one word. Not a hello, hru, are you a zombie or do you prefer brains with your noodles. I would recommend everyone being personable with customers you never know if their a Yelper, Health inspector, yadda yadda yadda.   Thank you to our wonderful waitress for setting a high standard of service. As for the food, it was literally finger licking, lip sucking good! Having moved from NYC, I tasted some authentic Asian and Asian Fusion noodles dishes and I must say this met my expectations. My hat off to the kitchen/chef.  If you're into noodles, check out this gem! You won't be disappointed!  Ramen Short Rib Pad See Wey Mimosa Proseco

UPDATE:  We spoke to the manager and showed him the issue about our food. He did give us a full refund with a fresh order of the same thing we ordered (Veggie lovers). 7pULz9a3eACISof9dZZC0w.text: I can not say enough good things about this place. Food is amazing. Service is amazing. Location is amazing. Okay.. maybe the parking isn't the greatest but I live in the area so that's not a problem for me!   First off! Make sure you check in on yelp! There might be a little something in it for you ;)   I've been frequenting this spot recently because it's just so easy to just go and get a different variety. They have sushi, poke, noodles, and tons of great appetizers. The options are endless!!   The many times we've been in we have been served by Jackie (and seated by her twin sister!) But she has been absolutely the best. But everyone else that has helped us in the restaurant has been absolutely amazing.   They have to go orders and you can get it delivered. Explore the menu and find out what this place is all about!!

BXCf-MRzmKt42PEDStVFVQ.text: Deejai NoDa is so great, beautifully presented...on the plate. Deejai Noda, noodles are yummy. Feel so full, in my tummy. Deejai NoDa, fresh sauces and rice. One through five, for levels of spice!

We barely had a wait on a Friday night, and the waitress was super helpful as we asked questions about what to get. I had a California roll and the chicken pad Thai. The California roll was pretty standard, but the pad Thai was great. It was a hearty serving with lots of chicken. I asked for it mild, and the spice level was perfect. Awesome experience, especially with the Groupon!

I wanted to try some sushi as well but I was so full that I couldn't take another bite so that will be for next time. Parking here is a pain as with the rest of NoDa. C_TTrcOyfyG5vdwJDd4MMA.text: I had to try it!! Of course I do, it's hot and new!  I went on a Sunday for brunch and it was slow at first and then got busy as the day went on.  The server was really out of it.  She was completely confused and the whole greeting/ordering was not ideal.  Really no conversation, not asking if we'd been before, no explaining of the menu or specials.  That was disappointing.   The appetizers: (edamame & spring rolls) and sushi (honey) were good. The spring rolls had a great peanut dipping sauce.  The drunken noodles, I ordered a special way, omitting some items and the waitress literally came back three times to ask me what the order was again. After writing it down the first time.  Well, third times a charm, because it came out tasty!  I got 4 spicy, but could've done 5.   Mango sticky rice was delicious.  Food was very good. Environment was nice...beautiful inside and a patio outside.  Service, not what I would've expected.  Maybe a bad day.

U6YkAXFFA8QJtfx-G04-Mg.text: Deejai NoDa is such a cool concept.   I stopped in on Sunday afternoon and the food was good, however the service was a bit off.   The place was relatively empty when we arrived and we were seated right away. The hostess that took us to our seat, ended up being our waitress but she never introduced herself and seemed to be a bit confused about the menu and the overall service.   However, the service aside the food was pretty good. I tried the Honey Honey roll and the Drunken Noodles with shrimp. The sushi roll was just okay. It didn't wow me, but I think a few other places have spoiled me. However, it was very pretty when it arrived to the table.  The drunken noodles were very good. I ordered them with some modifications and a spice level #4 and would definitely order it again! They use nice size shrimp and all the flavors worked together so nicely. Plus, it arrived hot to the table pipping hot and I loved the flower! If you're debating what to try first - I'd recommend starting with this dish!   Overall, good presentation and good flavors! Once they work the service out this place has real potential.

photos.caption: Photo of Deejai  Noodle Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Deejai  Noodle Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Deejai  Noodle Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States

yBv8TyMWMBAOvjR0vGnSFQ.text: Deejai is really good! I have had it twice now and both times food was awesome. They have a pretty wide selection of cucumber wrap rolls which I love. I got the three amigos and would easily order it again. Very good quality sushi. Pork belly tacos are also good though the pork belly could've been better. They kind of shred it vs giving you a big thick piece. Don't skip dessert. The thai crepe with ice cream was delicious! Great addition to NoDa.

Oyxf82PewcjiH8_4QT6C6A.text: Full disclosure, I've never had Ramen noodles outside of the ones you buy for less than a dollar at a grocery store.  Sad.  Walking into this place I could see it was popular as it was not overly crowded but nicely populated for a Tuesday evening.    Seating was comfy and service quaint and served alongside a smile.  I ordered a cocktail and while it was a bit too sweet for me, it was as described.  For my entree I chose the Ramen noodle short rib dish.  It was fantastic and the short rib portion was cooked to perfection.  Warms my bones.  Parking is a bit of a challenge in the main lot but there is a gravel parking lot across the street that is very manageable.

Z_z8l8woUb4nZgP4mnbyEw.text: I'm glad I came to check this place out, and will be adding it into my rotation for sushi/noodles. I went on a Tuesday, where it's BOGO half off rolls. I had the spicy tuna and honey honey roll. Both were very tasty, although I feel like the Siracha sauce was a little strong on the spicy tuna. Don't get me wrong, I love it spicy, but usually there's a good blend of spice, not just a lot of siracha. The honey honey was delicious, but they were out of avacado, so I got all salmon on top...which I certainly did not mind!   I love that they have a large patio area and a garage door that opens in the nice weather, really giving it a great vibe. The servers were friendly and punctual and very knowledgeable about the sushi selections! If you're in Noda, definitely stop by this place!!

photos.caption: Photo of Deejai  Noodle Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Honey honey and spicy tuna

0whb3QaedMpVeZ0VFuvklQ.text: If you were like me a few days ago, wondering if you should come here for dinner, just put your fears aside and make the trip. I was motivated by the glowing reviews, no doubt. So here's another one for them. The ginger lemonade was great, coming from someone who isn't the biggest fan on ginger drinks. I even had a few, it was that good with a little alcohol kick to it. Started off with the steamed dumplings, soft with a nice bite to them. I'll get the fried ones next time to compare.  The fried rice was delicious, exactly what I've come to expect from a Thai restaurant. I ordered both the Tsunami and Lobster Rolls. I prefer the Tsunami by a slight margin, but you can't go wrong with either. My date had soup, I can't recall the name, but it had Seafood and a curry base- not like that could narrow it down, right? Lol! Great food, great service.

BUaPiXFaXl308ush98A-dQ.text: When Tonya says let's go eat here, your answer should almost always be "Yes ma'am". Such is the case here. Yes we pre-gamed at Birdsong a bit before coming here and then saw Weezer in concert (who by the way rule) later, so our trip here was part convenience of location and part pre show sustenance. That being said, the food here is freakin' yum.  So the rest of this review is a bit incoherent and I may not have taken many if any good photos. Yeah, it was one of THOSE nights...  What our group ate:  Edamame (free check in offer!!) Crispy Chicken Spring Rolls Thai Chicken Wings Lemongrass Pork Bowl Green Curry  We sucked down all those goodies like Hoover vacuums! Not a crumb of deliciousness escaped our wrath.  If that wasn't enough throw in a half priced bottle of wine (Wednesdays)and some Asian beers.... Hooah!

gQbQc7tehqVvTFSZpLAr-w.text: My husband brought us here on a Groupon. We walked in and was seated almost immediately. We asked for one of the high top tables and we were able to get seated at one. The restaurant is pretty big with a long couch from end-to-end where multiple people can fit with tables in front of them. The decor is very eclectic and the staff was very friendly.  I ordered the Poke Bowl and it was absolutely amazing and very filling. We also got the Thai wings which had the right amount of spice to it and a lot of sauce just the way we like it. I ordered the mango drink and that was really good and sweet. As I sat there eating and people watching, it made me feel like I was somewhere else, but not in Charlotte. The vibe was so cool. This place gets 5 stars from me! Everything was amazing. We will definitely be back soon.

photos.caption: Photo of Deejai  Noodle Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Thai wings!
Photo of Deejai  Noodle Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. You have to try the poke bowl!

oSlTvLjcIhRhkS9zCwZRjw.text: It's not that close to the other places in NoDa but it's a nice set up. The were not able to sell any alcohol yesterday for unknown reasons. We ordered 1 sushi starter & 1 regular starter. The salmon capiccao was ok, the salmon could have been sliced thinner and the red onions were over powering the fresh salmon. It took 20 minutes to get The Godfather roll & almost 35 minutes to get the Lotus Flower roll it had to be baked but we didn't know that up front (maybe our own fault) and they were not busy at all. The pad Thai came out quickly but we asked for shrimp & he brought us chicken, honest mistake. We wanted the cold noodle salad but they no longer sell it & the menu had not been updated.  Not my favorite but it was nice.

FKSvH0UvFQYrUrwX6x9eIg.text: I've been here a handful of times and it's always phenomenal. The staff all work together and create a comfortable, friendly environment for every customer who works in the door. They seem to have a ton of regulars... a rather good sign for such a new restaurant!   The wings are amazing, to start. I've had a handful of their lunch dishes and have loved every one of them... and they're such a great deal. Basil chicken and drunken noodles are both delicious. The sushi items I've tried seem to be fresh and filling as well. A definite must try if you're around the NoDa area!

photos.caption: Photo of Deejai  Noodle Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Kimchi poke bowl and drunken noodles with chicken!

wy3NUUVUsHSDvoUca7SpFw.text: Drinks... Food.... Sauces... Everything was just FANTASTIC. I had Thai good 2 days before coming here so I was just not in the mood for it but I had to use a Groupon before it expired. We've all been there though right!?  I am so glad I came. It has a sexy "I feel like I'm not even in Charlotte" vibe but that's Noda for you. It's really small and can feel kinda tight but they make a really great use of the space.  I was really surprised at how inexpensive everything was. We had $40 for our Groupon and found it difficult to spend all of it without getting an appetizer, dessert or both. We went with both! .  Though it was tough to choose an appetizer (because I get pork belly whenever I see it on the menu and the pork belly tacos looks delicious) we went with the Thai wings but we were certainly not disappointed. They were so amazing! Their ranch was also very good.  For my meal I chose the pork and rice and I knew it was going to be delicious just from the presentation. I was right! So good! It came with two sauces and it was super hard to know which one to dip next. It also came with a soup with a cilantro based broth that was also very good. It was a nice surprise because I don't remember seeing it on the menu.  My wife. One of the Poke bowls. I can't remember which one but it's the only one that has jalapenos and it's also the most expensive thing on the menu. Also very delicious.  On the table you'll find your standard spicy garlic sauce but they had another green signs that I've never had at another and I Restaurant. You had to take him to go. It was so good!  Suffice it to say we're buying another Groupon and will be here again soon!

Photo of Deejai  Noodle Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Love this place!
Photo of Deejai  Noodle Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Poke bowl! #Yum

nxe91d88DSnIdgmEAZPyOg.text: Solid experience.   Came with friends for a double date just a few days ago. We started with drinks and appetizers. They weren't too familiar with their own draft list, which was a bit of a bummer. The sake cocktails are ok. I wouldn't recommend ordering one.   We had edamame and wings as an appetizer. The wings were very good. Delicious sauce.   I ordered the Kao Soi. They also serve this at Rai Lay, their sister restaurant. Everyone at the table wished they had ordered my dish. It's their signature, and it's fantastic! We've had this dish in Northern Thailand where it originated and there's is just as good.   My friends ordered their pork ramen. They said it was good, but said it didn't have the depth of flavor of the kao soi.   I have been one other time and loved the salmon curry. It was delicious, and I'd never had anything like it.   Last but not least, order the mango sticky rice. Just do it. It's so friggin good.

photos.caption: Photo of Deejai  Noodle Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Mango sticky rice
Photo of Deejai  Noodle Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Pork ramen
Photo of Deejai  Noodle Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Salmon curry

pZjLtM8kJ1qg75l7g11g8A.text: We've been to this place a lot as it is close to home, the food is pretty good and there is never a wait. The service is always fast and everyone is friendly. They always have drink specials as well as local beers on tap. Plus, they are right next to Divine Barrel if you are looking for food after a few beers.   The food is what I would guess is pretty authentic. The most recent time we visited, I ordered the salmon curry soup. This is a creamy soup... very rich. It basically is a coconut milk and curry broth with noodles, two filets of salmon, and lots of veggies. I appreciate all the veggies and the pescatarian option. I also like that you can customize your spice level, you just have to ask. Most things you order are also large enough to have leftovers, which is awesome.  However, I will say their sushi seems a little pricey. Maybe their roles are bigger than other sushi places in Charlotte, but I've honestly never ordered one because I hate to spend $20 on a meal of 2 rolls that I know I'll eat all of versus $18-20 on something I will get leftovers from.  The vibe of the place is what would call a take on a sportsbar? They have a good number of tvs and always have some game or another on. It's not absurdly loud, but it can get a bit noisy in there if the restaurant is full. The only complaint I have is that their front door doesn't have a waiting area or entrance area, so there's not much room to stand and when bigger groups come, the front door gets left open, and it was very cold and drafty on our last visit.  They also do takeout!

7SACRp6wnYIZI3VdFEsepg.text: There were so many good looking options, it was a little overwhelming to make a selection. Our server was very helpful, as she knew a lot about the menu. Everything we got was great - I especially enjoyed the pork belly tacos we ordered as a starter. Went on a weeknight, so not sure what this place is like on the weekends, but we were quickly seated on a Wednesday. Looking forward to going back!

8N0CIG3lBm_HW3lZLVnkpg.text: Shout outs to @davette08 for recommending. Dinner last night was pretty much amazing. If you're in the Charlotte, NC area, be sure to check out Deejai Noodle bar in NoDa!! @deejainoda service was excellent and the food was . We had the honey honey roll and Thai chili wings to start (not pictured because it was demolished), kabuto roll, Pad see You, and the Thai crepe for dessert (the best part). You get a free bowl of edamame with your checkin on Yelp!! Go check them out.  And now for this workout to work it off  #foodie #checkandbalances #foodiesofinstagram #foodporn #foodphotography #foodies #charlottenc #charlotteeats #carolinagirl #blogger #lifestyleblogger #bossbabe #bosslady #fitnessmotivation #fitness #healthylifestyle #thiswasnthealthythough

V_YsLiZoZlzOG4bNXk1roA.text: We had the pork belly tacos which were very flavourful. They have make a sweet and tangy chilli sauce that pairs well with it. We both had the salmon curry for our entrees and l substituted rice for noodles.  The salmon was flaky and crunchy on the outside. Curry had lots of flavour! We went for dinner and thought the portions were pretty decent. Salmon was about $16 and they didn't charge me extra for the rice sub.  Our hostess was not as attentive and seemed to chat more with the usual customers (overhead her welcome them back). We had to keep flagging her down which I did not like.  She was also impatient, like we bothered her when we asked her questions about the menu even when we told her that was our first time there.

kOGlzbFTUf4rJqUfGB0OVg.text: Our server Lin was super sweet and helpful with suggesting entrees. We tried the Pad Thai with tofu and the Spicy Basil Noodle with tofu. Great dishes with huge dinner portions! The Pad Thai had a very strong cilantro taste which can be a turn off to some, but it gives the dish a fresh, herby taste. Prices are fair for the amount and quality of food you receive! Great service from Lin and delicious dishes made our experience at Deejai NoDa  terrific!

PB57cxWT1WVZ2J2dEyOiTg.text: Very cool place. Best shrimp I've ever had. Pork and duck were also delicious. Highly recommend this place. Parking lot is small but there is street parking nearby.  Update Nov 2018 - Another place in Charlotte ruined by a swarm of yuppies. Restaurant quality is slipping. Portion size is way too large and they are having problems making simple dishes. Ordered Mango sticky rice brought a place of pineapples and Ice Cream.

_qOE8r_1ATS4y4GaJbLUKg.text: This was my first time here but not my last. My husband and I loved it. We were surprised to find it hopping on a Sunday afternoon. A very good sign indeed! I had the pad Thai (that's my first dish anytime I eat at a new Thai place), and my husband had the drunken noodles. Deelish! The lunch portion was more than enough for me; I took half of it home with me. I highly recommend Deejai.

bdhgjoiXIP_RC2aI77VOng.text: Total bait and switch on prices between the order time and the pickup time.  When I questioned they used the 'Oh the website has not been updated' excuse.   I complained - they said the prices are a couple year old.    I ordered $18 - total was $28.00  This is no accident - she says people make this mistake all the time.    I will not make this mistake again.  Enjoy!!!

c771K8u62gpWRsH4UNYbZg.text: Very hip feeling restaurant on the inside. The decor is very modern but also a touch rustic. Parking is super tight in a little lot with awkward angles. We were greeted and seated immediately. Our waters were filled up right after we sat down - and they have the yummy crushed/slush ice! The menu is succinct and I appreciate that. We ordered pad see you, larb chicken, spicy tuna poke bowl, and spicy basil fried rice. The poke bowl was a bit too vinegary for me to enjoy it. The fried rice was amazing but literally sat in a puddle of dark yellow oil, which made it kind of unappetizing upon seeing.  The pad see you and larb chicken were good as well.  The service was average and it is slightly pricey. The restaurant is worth visiting and trying for sure! I don't think it's for me, but I definitely don't regret going.

or_JBS3vCs7AnIoaAfB5-Q.text: NoDa needed a sushi restaurant so badly and thank goodness Deejai NoDa opened up. The staff is so friendly, they have a great beer selection and the sushi taste s o o fresh! I also like they have a really diverse menu with a lot of offerings.  Thank you for getting lunch specials! I love the buy 1 get 1 half off on Tuesday

photos.caption: Photo of Deejai  Noodle Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Ginger salad

WZMxkOYCSGcedUVsKZZ05w.text: As a long-time Deejai Providence Rd (original location) fan, I was super excited to learn they were expanding to a part of town that still seems, well, experimental.  Though it is now considered part of 'greater' NoDa, besides this place, there's just a bar/coffee place, 2 breweries, a paint store, and loads of apartments.  As NoDa expands and the light rail brings people and demand, things will rapidly change.  The food here is reliably good and tasty.  I've indulged mostly in an old standard - pad Thai - and it's really, REALLY good. I've also tried some of the appetizer dumplings and shared in the poke bowl.    Aside from eating in-house once, I've mostly taken advantage of their quick and efficient delivery next door at Divine Barrel Brewery.  This has become a go-to "activity" for my wife and I.  Good job, Deejai NoDa.  Good job!

photos.caption: Photo of Deejai  Noodle Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Take out!

TkgG9Hhdv3ztnt0Vr3E5NQ.text: On a freezing cold December night when it's late and not too many places are open, Deejai NoDa for the win.   Stopped in for dinner on a quiet night, restaurant wasn't too full. It is freshly made, well seasoned Thai food. I had the shrimp pad thai and it was really good. Lots of shrimp and the noodles were good.   Prices aren't bad either, I would return!

ZSKCCBE0IZ2guPDvzVYBhg.text: I've come a couple times before, but tonight the service was terrible. Took several minutes to get a server at our table to take our drink/food order. I ordered a small Tom yum soup that took far too long to arrive, and was lukewarm (flavor was fine, but nothing special). The sushi roll (honey honey roll) I ordered sat at the counter for a good 30 minutes or so. When we finally got our food, the sushi was missing avocado (an ingredient listed on the menu) - sent it back for avocado, and received no apology, no offer to remake,  and they put a few slices on the side. Will not be returning!

pJo4SE2k0m4DIE9VKo-yCA.text: Th food was excellent, but their beer selection absolutely sucked. They only have three beer choices and all of them were unbelievably bitter. If you are going  stop by for the food and a glass of water, you won't be disappointed.

nN7i8ujF52DPPlGChrDyIw.text: This place is awesome. Rumor has it you come for the food but come back for the service and both are great here. We have been here several times and the service and food have been phenomenal. The dumplings are delicious and the wings are some of the best in the city. We will definitely be back...a lot.

CnV_e9sRD0Ahq9nuA64XIg.text: Let me preface my review...I'm tough on Thai restaurants, more than any other cuisine! I was born in Bangkok and graduated high school there. I know good authentic Thai food and am usually disappointed in the dumbed down "farang" (foreigner) versions dished out most.  IWas very excited to see Deejai open another location. The Noda/Plaza Midwood areas have sorely needed a Thai restaurant.  Deejai Noda does a really nice job.  They haven't had their grand opening so the menu was still limited. My girlfriend and I have sampled Deejai 2 times in the last week, dine in and cary out.  Dine in appetizer was the fried won tons, tasty but slightly over done..but not a miss, the green papaya salad was just ok...too many noodles, not enough green papaya and very mild heat....needs work IMO.  We shared the Nam Prik as a main dish and it was very good. We ordered the springs rols and Nam Prik again for take out and it was even better.   Check it out

-C-DZziKUa0FWWTz_ho3sA.text: Had an excellent experience on my first visit. I ordered the "Drunken Noodles" and it was absolutely delicious! I'll probably order it with a little less "spicy" next time but we had outstanding service and the food was even better. Thanks!!

FWYO4_-bflBXTiZ6buXmdA.text: It's not often I sit down and look at a menu and there are soooo many choices I want to try that it's hard to make up my mind. Deejay NoDa has such a menu. Such great dishes!  Everything my wife and I chose was beautifully presented and cooked to perfection. Stellar service and a real nice space made this a memorable meal.

UaDYwzswQBTUYC0L0O42fg.text: The ramen short rib was awesome and hopefully they keep it on the menu after their grand opening.

NhKv8ugVCXjdOb6gx1v2kQ.text: Deejai NoDa is one of the best Thai restaurants in Charlotte. The food is consistent and the service is spectacular. I've been visiting Deejai Thai for years and when they opened this location I had to try it as well. They've actually become my favorite!  (Although it seems they are no longer owned by the same person).   I generally get the edamame or Thai chicken wings as my starter. My CURRENT favorite entree would be the drunken noodles with shrimp! It's always full of flavor. The Pad Thai is also excellent. You can't go wrong with either of these dishes. By far my favorite Thai Family (Deejai Noda, Deejai Thai and Rai Lay)

GH6ztjDok3NHEdtexem9Tg.text: We finally made it to DeeJai, I've had the original location bookmarked for a long time and never made it there. Father's Day weekend while in Noda walking around with my family my husband stated that he was getting hungry so we began to try to decide where to eat having many choices in the area. I thought back to a couple days prior at a Yelp Elite event at Jeni Splendid right around the corner where Michelle P. (Yelp buddy) mentioned heading to the new DeeJai in NoDa since it was so close by. I made mention to my husband and he was totally game.  We decided to WALK which was not the BEST idea when it's hot out or when you have a stroller as the sidewalks end and start up a block later a couple times if walking from NoDa coming from Haberdish direction. However we made it, HOT but we made it and was seated immediately and provided excellent customer service. They noticed that we may be parch and offered us cold water which was appreciated .  We started with the veggie spring roll app as well as the mussel app. My children devoured the spring rolls before my hubby and I got a chance to taste them so we had to order more. They were really good and flavorful, I had to squeeze them in a napkin first because there was a lot of grease. The mussels were a must must must. You mussss get the mussels and order a side of rice with them #ThankMeLater  The mussel broth was extremely flavorful that we refuse to let it go away from the table post mussels so we ordered rice and was able to make a rice dish with the veggies and green curry sauce from the mussels. Yum yum yum  My husband tried the curry salmon as a entree and he enjoyed it, we ordered based on yelp suggestions and I wouldn't say it wasn't a good suggestion.  The curry on the salmon was good yet different from the mussels (green vs yellow) and after having the green curry nothing could compare. My only tidbit about this place other than the too much grease on the spring rolls (should let them drain a little before serving them) is the fact that they don't have their liquide license yet and I was in the mood for a cocktail. Ooh I mush mention we were also not informed about the many mocktails when we inquired and ended up sky water and Thai Tea. We noticed the sign on the way out which sucked.

Sglp_W7vmEnTJGiLnFCzQA.text: Update...Loved the place, poke bowls, despite Bogo sushi deal.  Still a bit pricey but you get a full meal and beats others in the neighborhood.  The is under new ownership though, and you can see the corners being cut. They moved to artificially colored and cheap ginger. The poke bowls suddenly have twice as much rice and less poke. No condiments unless requested....20$ for a bowl  $16 for fried rice...not exactly expensive, but quality IS suffering.

tf3poDTIM8nwnS8Id5PVxw.text: Went there for lunch on a Saturday. My wife and I split the Pad Thai and Kao Moo Dang. The Pad Thai was excellent! Not especially spicy but very well flavored. They provide extra hot sauce to adjust the heat level yourself. We did not care for the Kao Moo Dang. The pork was very dry and bland. It did come with a sauce, but I didn't care for the flavor of the sauce either. We also had some edamame which was free with the Yelp check in, and it was good. The fried noodles that came with the entree were also very tasty with the sweet and sour sauce.

photos.caption: Photo of Deejai  Noodle Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Menu

v_syBA8eWMHJS6sa2a7Qaw.text: I've been meaning to check out Deejai for awhile now, and am so glad I finally did!   Surprisingly, the place is fairly big for a Noodles bar (think I was expecting a Japanese-sized Ramen bar?). Well, maybe not big...but long? Also, I liked the long, continuous booth-style seating, and its casual, yet chic decor. They had some extra-sweet touches as well, like gorgeous flowers placed on every table and elegantly-folded napkins!  Anyway, decided to try their Salmon Curry...and it was Amazing!! The spiciness was perfect, the salmon was delicious, and I loved the variety of unique veggies.  Unlike some ethnic foods, where you have to order veggies on the side/a la carte, I love how most Thai dishes come with an abundance of veggies, along with the meats. I was also impressed with the complimentary wonton strips. For drinks, I tried their Thai Iced Tea...which came in a long, elegant glass. Unfortunately, I didn't love the drink, but it was Okay. To cap it all off, I had their Thai Crepe...and this was to die for!!! I absolutely love crepes, ice cream and mangos...and this had all three!  Service was quick, attentive and friendly...even informative. I was even given a card, which is basically their rewards program, offering $10 off on 6th visit (?).  The only real issue I had was the heat...but then, it was my decision to sit right by the garage-window, with the sun blasting through. Not sure if the rest of the restaurant was cooler and air conditioned, but my seating area was quite warm.    Overall, this might be one of the best (if not THE??) Thai restaurants I've been to in Charlotte...and I've been to alot! Can't wait to try a few more things on their menu...if I can resist the Salmon Curry again, that is!

-pbkpqWRV9Zf5vf-I49Law.text: Our experience at Deejai Noda Noodle Car was a little disappointing. Though the customer service was better than average, the food is not worth the cost. We split the Salmon Curry and Honey Honey Roll. I was underwhelmed by the $17 dish.

9n1JIZtnFZ-weLdR-qiWGQ.text: Our bartender Rocky was very good. I watched him go from 4 people at bar to a full restaurant. The way he handled everything was very efficient between service bar and his bar. Good work! I wish I could have asked him about all the drinks he made because they looked awesome!  I believe this place has new owners. I didn't notice any changes other than they didn't have liquor license for awhile.  The Kao Soy is what we come here for!!! We drive from uptown when we want to switch up from Rai Lay.  The spicy basil chicken is different from Rai Lays. Not sure which one I like better  we usually split the kao soy at the restaurant then take our other food home to eat later. The portions are HUGE

8kjPR9kvZYJFSVEEUQGV4w.text: Went for a friends birthday had never been before it was amazing. My food was on point an we picked a perfect time they were very busy after we ate dinner. Service was perfect the menu was very well explained to us. I had a dish that I do not recall the name lol My dish was so good the chicken an my veggies with the sauce I had enough for a to go box. The spring rolls were good I could have ate like 5 but needed room for dinner. Make a trip to Deejai in Noda we loved it. I will be back food was amazing

4HrJ23FhM0MoLcrd0j_dVA.text: Let me tell you, any restaurant that's playing Red Light Special when I walk in is an instant winner in my book. TLC, Destiny's Child, the playlist was on point this a Wednesday evening.  Speaking of Wednesday, it was half price bottles of wine night. Let's talk about self-control, Andrea and I stuck to water and behaved on a school night. Don't worry, we're not total grown ups, there was a good 5 minute long debate beforehand.  Let's get down to business, I love their Tom Yum soup here. I always get it with shrimp. Usually I'll get a hot pot for myself (for the 'gram of course), but also so I can have leftovers to take home. For this latest trip, we went with the Hamachi Yellowtail with jalapeno and wasabi yuzu sauce (appetizer on the specials menu), Drunken Noodles with chicken, and each got our own individual bowls of Tom Yum (only because we would both be gone the next day and didn't want to waste leftovers). It was all delicious. The Drunken Noodles was a good-sized portion. We still ended up both taking home leftovers of that. No complaints here.  Specials: (listed as of 2/27/2019) Tuesday: buy 1, get 1 half off sushi roll (less or equal value) Wednesday: half price bottles of wine Thursday: $4 draft beers Friday: $1 off local canned beers  The parking lot in front of the restaurant is small and super awkward. But don't worry, there's other parking options including a lot diagonally across the street (on the opposite side of Bold Missy).

Photo of Deejai  Noodle Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Drunken noodles
Photo of Deejai  Noodle Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Tom Yum

7ckvui8ouXPHc6T-EPQ5ng.text: I came in here to celebrate my birthday with an original party of 9. Since it was a larger group, I made reservations the day before. However, when I walked in to the restaurant and said I had a reservation they completely disregarded that and only stated that they had the table in the front with 8 seats and 1 person would have to sit at the end. These tables were super high with uncomfortable seats- I would recommend asking for seats near the back. When I walked back to the bathroom it looked really cozy. I wished I had asked for that area. Also there are only 2 bathrooms- 1 for men and 1 for women. They should consider making them unisex because they are both the exact same- the men's doesn't have a urinal in it!   Service was pretty good, it took a while for the food to come but we didn't mind since we had checked in for our free edamame and that was holding us over. Each person who checks in gets a free bowl! Our server was also really nice when another person joined our party- now a party of 10. He was hard to get ahold of sometimes even though the restaurant space was pretty small.   Now, for the best part: the food! It was sooo delicious! I got the drunken noodles with tofu and that tofu was perfectly cooked. I've had some drunken noodles before that were too dry or too saucy and not flavorful. The drunken noodles at Deejai are amazing. The perfect amount of sauce and flavor. I was really sad when I forgot my leftovers at the restaurant. I also got the lycheetini which was perfect. Loved that they put a lychee in there. The other members of the party liked their food too, however a few people who got soups said that the soup was only warm and not hot enough for them. I didn't get to try them myself. Another friend loved the sushi!  I would definitely come back here, probably with a smaller group because the restaurant space is smaller and it's hard to navigate with a larger group though the server did a fairly good job at it. They didn't do anything extra for my birthday which might bum some people but the amazing noodles certainly made it up for me.

ZxeOrXc2p6dexagI8peUYA.text: I am a curry fan and any place with a good curry gets my vote. Deejai does not disappoint.   This time I opted to try something different and ordered sushi. It was equally as tasty.   I sat at bar and the bartender was very attentive and helpful. He suggested the best curry for my friend.   The atmosphere is great, the staff are friendly, the playlist is good and the food is better. The only downfall is the tight parking. But, for great curry one can overlook the parking.

1yH5dTiE1Fq8Xb7tga9dpw.text: First time at Deejai and I was impressed! I think between all the construction around Craighead and just the cramped feeling of NoDa lately in general, I have overlooked this gem of a restaurant time and time again, but I'm glad I finally made it.  Yet another cold night where no one in the house felt like cooking, so tonight seemed like a good opportunity to cross this place off the "must try" list. Me and the wife arrived around 7:30 to a relatively busy restaurant but were immediately seated. First things first, check-in on Yelp! Free Edamame check-in offer and it's not a 'freebie' size, it's the same as the $5 starter on the menu!  I'm a simple guy with simple tastes, so I see Pad Thai on the menu at a Thai restaurant, and I'm gettin' it! Krissy got the Ramen Short Rib and we split the Edamame while we waited on the entrees. In perfect timing fashion, our bowls came out as soon as the last soy bean was gone!  The Pad Thai was visually stunning. Vibrant green cilantro, fresh purple cabbage, orange tamarind sauce, and thin noodles with peanuts and scallions all came together for a wonderful flavor profile. The sauce was the dominant taste of the dish with a sweet and sour vibe. It might have been a little too sweet for my taste but everything worked well all the same. Chicken was moist and complimented the dish very well. I was especially happy with the veggies. They chop the scallions coarsely but cook them tender, giving them a nice crunch while still rounding out the harsh onion notes to a more mellow level.  I had a few bites of my wife's ramen bowl and while she thought the broth could have been spicier, I appreciated the delicate complexity of the dashi style profile. An earthy base with bright, salty notes. To each their own, but I would have been happy with either her dish or mine, no regrets!  Read the other reviews on the parking situation, it's a no-win situation but there's not many other options. Maybe take a light jog from the sugar creek parking deck?  I'll keep Deejai NoDa on my radar for whenever I'm in the mood for some quality Thai Cuisine. With a whole menu of unique dishes, there's a whole lot more to explore here.

Photo of Deejai  Noodle Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Make sure to Check-In, free order of Edamame as a check-in offer! The power of Yelp!

I5XUultIHCF_bXhwAIcAWA.text: 1st time here! I came here to celebrate with a large group. The servers were very prompt and attentive to handling a large party. I was able to get the edamane with the Yelp check in.  I ordered green curry with shrimp and the wings. I love the wings (saved those for lunch for the next day). The shrimp and green curry was excellent! It had lots of vegetables and wonderful shrimp. I even tried the pain killer drink...I wasn't a fan of that.  My only concern is when it was time to pay the tab, our server could not find one of our table guests, and instead of looking for her, she made it appear that the person left without paying, even though their boxed food and wallet was on the table still. The manager did not handle that situation professionally. Other than that, I will come here again.

zzcNBfiQUUA8sJ7xzhB3yQ.text: Hated how the waitress automatically included an 18% tip on our bill. The service was moderate/poor but the food was phenomenal. OpdgONgZnksPx0DBP9CO5w.text: Deejai is a place that my girlfriend and I have become fond of the last few months. When we discovered it, we ended up getting hangover Thai from here two weekends in a row.   I haven't actually been in the restaurant itself, we've gotten delivery and picked up food, so I can't speak on the setting inside or outside.  What I can speak on is the awesome quality of the food. I've had some of the sushi, a couple different noodle bowls, and the fried rice. It's ALL good.  Being fairly new to the sushi game, I'm always a little hesitant to order sushi from somewhere and eat it anywhere but the restaurant. The dynamite roll I got from Deejai was GREAT after I brought it home and there was a ton in the box, too.  The fried rice is stupid good. I'd eat it hot. I'd eat it cold. I'd eat it in between.There's a bunch of different flavors in there and they do it so well.  The best dish I've had is the salmon curry! The amount of flavor they get out of that curry is insane. I'm not a huge salmon fan either, but this is just delicious. You can ask them to spice it up pretty generously but be careful, they give you what you ask for.  Overall I'd say this is a great place to pick up some Thai or get some delivered. I look forward to trying more things on the menu!
